Description: Baked clay figurine of nude winged male in a cloak playing a set of Pan-pipes; originally covered in a white slip which acted as a ground for applied coloured pigments; one wing missing and much of the slip worn away.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Bibliographic references: Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.167)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995-2005 17 Nov-15 Dec BM, G52/IRAN/25, from official opening 1994 16 Jun-23 Dec BM, G49/IRAN/25
Condition: Fair; one wing missing and much of slip worn away.
Acquisition notes: Acquired by the British Museum as a result of Budge's second mission to Egypt and Mesopotamia in 1887-1888; the mission was intended to investigate the "leakage" of tablets from sites supposedly guarded on behalf of the British Museum. Further notes on acquisition and bibliographic references relating to acquisition in catalogue introduction pp.xv-xvii.
